summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The first account I composed, Theophilus, about all that Jesus began to do and teach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the day when He was taken up to heaven, after He had by the Holy Spirit given orders to the apostles whom He had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To these He also presented Himself alive after His suffering, by many convincing proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days and speaking of the things concerning the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gathering them together, He commanded them not to leave Jerusalem, but to wait for what the Father had promised, “Which,” He said, “you heard of from Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had come together, they were asking Him, saying, “Lord, is it at this time You are restoring the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It is not for you to know times or epochs which the Father has fixed by His own authority;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you shall be My witnesses both in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and even to the remotest part of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after He had said these things, He was lifted up while they were looking on, and a cloud received Him out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were gazing intently into the sky while He was going, behold, two men in white clothing stood beside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also said, “Men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who has been taken up from you into heaven, will come in just the same way as you have watched Him go into heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had entered the city, they went up to the upper room where they were staying; that is, Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all with one mind were continually devoting themselves to prayer, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this time Peter stood up in the midst of the brethren (a gathering of about one hundred and twenty persons was there together), and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brethren, the Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit foretold by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was counted among us and received his share in this ministry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now this man acquired a field with the price of his wickedness, and falling headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his intestines gushed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it became known to all who were living in Jerusalem; so that in their own language that field was called Hakeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For it is written in the book of Psalms,
‘Let his homestead be made desolate,
And let no one dwell in it’;
and,
‘Let another man take his office.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is necessary that of the men who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beginning with the baptism of John until the day that He was taken up from us—one of these must become a witness with us of His resurrection.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they put forward two men, Joseph called Barsabbas (who was also called Justus), and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they prayed and said, “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two You have chosen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to occupy this ministry and apostleship from which Judas turned aside to go to his own place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they drew lots for them, and the lot fell to Matthias; and he was added to the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day of Pentecost had come, they were all together in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there came from heaven a noise like a violent rushing wind, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared to them tongues as of fire distributing themselves, and they rested on each one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit was giving them utterance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were Jews living in Jerusalem, devout men from every nation under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when this sound occurred, the crowd came together, and were bewildered because each one of them was hearing them speak in his own language.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were amazed and astonished, saying, “Why, are not all these who are speaking Galileans?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how is it that we each hear them in our own language to which we were born?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians and Medes and Elamites, and residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the districts of Libya around Cyrene, and visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cretans and Arabs—we hear them in our own tongues speaking of the mighty deeds of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all continued in amazement and great perplexity, saying to one another, “What does this mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others were mocking and saying, “They are full of sweet wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter, taking his stand with the eleven, raised his voice and declared to them: “Men of Judea and all you who live in Jerusalem, let this be known to you and give heed to my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these men are not drunk, as you suppose, for it is only the third hour of the day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but this is what was spoken of through the prophet Joel:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Even on My bondslaves, both men and women,
I will in those days pour forth of My Spirit
And they shall prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘And I will grant wonders in the sky above
And signs on the earth below,
Blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The sun will be turned into darkness
And the moon into blood,
Before the great and glorious day of the Lord shall come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And it shall be that everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men of Israel, listen to these words: Jesus the Nazarene, a man attested to you by God with miracles and wonders and signs which God performed through Him in your midst, just as you yourselves know—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this Man, delivered over by the predetermined plan and foreknowledge of God, you nailed to a cross by the hands of godless men and put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised Him up again, putting an end to the agony of death, since it was impossible for Him to be held in its power.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore my heart was glad and my tongue exulted;
Moreover my flesh also will live in hope;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because You will not abandon my soul to Hades,
Nor allow Your Holy One to undergo decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘You have made known to me the ways of life;
You will make me full of gladness with Your presence.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brethren, I may confidently say to you regarding the patriarch David that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so, because he was a prophet and knew that God had sworn to him with an oath to seat one of his descendants on his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he looked ahead and spoke of the resurrection of the Christ, that He was neither abandoned to Hades, nor did His flesh suffer decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Jesus God raised up again, to which we are all witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore having been exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He has poured forth this which you both see and hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it was not David who ascended into heaven, but he himself says:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at My right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let all the house of Israel know for certain that God has made Him both Lord and Christ—this Jesus whom you crucified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard this, they were pierced to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brethren, what shall we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to them, “Repent, and each of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins; and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the promise is for you and your children and for all who are far off, as many as the Lord our God will call to Himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with many other words he solemnly testified and kept on exhorting them, saying, “Be saved from this perverse generation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, those who had received his word were baptized; and that day there were added about three thousand souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were continually devoting themselves to the apostles’ teaching and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone kept feeling a sense of awe; and many wonders and signs were taking place through the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all those who had believed were together and had all things in common;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they began selling their property and possessions and were sharing them with all, as anyone might have need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Day by day continuing with one mind in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they were taking their meals together with gladness and sincerity of heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord was adding to their number day by day those who were being saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the ninth hour, the hour of prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man who had been lame from his mother’s womb was being carried along, whom they used to set down every day at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, in order to beg alms of those who were entering the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Peter and John about to go into the temple, he began asking to receive alms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter, along with John, fixed his gaze on him and said, “Look at us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to give them his attention, expecting to receive something from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “I do not possess silver and gold, but what I do have I give to you: In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene—walk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seizing him by the right hand, he raised him up; and immediately his feet and his ankles were strengthened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With a leap he stood upright and began to walk; and he entered the temple with them, walking and leaping and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were taking note of him as being the one who used to sit at the Beautiful Gate of the temple to beg alms, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was clinging to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them at the so-called portico of Solomon, full of amazement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Peter saw this, he replied to the people, “Men of Israel, why are you amazed at this, or why do you gaze at us, as if by our own power or piety we had made him walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified His servant Jesus, the one whom you delivered and disowned in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to release Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you disowned the Holy and Righteous One and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but put to death the Prince of life, the one whom God raised from the dead, a fact to which we are witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the basis of faith in His name, it is the name of Jesus which has strengthened this man whom you see and know; and the faith which comes through Him has given him this perfect health in the presence of you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, brethren, I know that you acted in ignorance, just as your rulers did also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the things which God announced beforehand by the mouth of all the prophets, that His Christ would suffer, He has thus fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore repent and return, so that your sins may be wiped away, in order that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that He may send Jesus, the Christ appointed for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom heaven must receive until the period of restoration of all things about which God spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets from ancient time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, ‘The Lord God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brethren; to Him you shall give heed to everything He says to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be that every soul that does not heed that prophet shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And likewise, all the prophets who have spoken, from Samuel and his successors onward, also announced these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is you who are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant which God made with your fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed all the families of the earth shall be blessed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you first, God raised up His Servant and sent Him to bless you by turning every one of you from your wicked ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were speaking to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple guard and the Sadducees came up to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being greatly disturbed because they were teaching the people and proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laid hands on them and put them in jail until the next day, for it was already evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many of those who had heard the message believed; and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Annas the high priest was there, and Caiaphas and John and Alexander, and all who were of high-priestly descent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had placed them in the center, they began to inquire, “By what power, or in what name, have you done this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers and elders of the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we are on trial today for a benefit done to a sick man, as to how this man has been made well,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let it be known to all of you and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead—by this name this man stands here before you in good health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the stone which was rejected by you, the builders, but which became the chief corner stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is salvation in no one else; for there is no other name under heaven that has been given among men by which we must be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they observed the confidence of Peter and John and understood that they were uneducated and untrained men, they were amazed, and began to recognize them as having been with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing the man who had been healed standing with them, they had nothing to say in reply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they had ordered them to leave the Council, they began to confer with one another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “What shall we do with these men? For the fact that a noteworthy miracle has taken place through them is apparent to all who live in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so that it will not spread any further among the people, let us warn them to speak no longer to any man in this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had summoned them, they commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and John answered and said to them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to give heed to you rather than to God, you be the judge;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we cannot stop speaking about what we have seen and heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had threatened them further, they let them go (finding no basis on which to punish them) on account of the people, because they were all glorifying God for what had happened;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the man was more than forty years old on whom this miracle of healing had been performed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had been released, they went to their own companions and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this, they lifted their voices to God with one accord and said, “O Lord, it is You who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and all that is in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who by the Holy Spirit, through the mouth of our father David Your servant, said,
‘Why did the Gentiles rage,
And the peoples devise futile things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The kings of the earth took their stand,
And the rulers were gathered together
Against the Lord and against His Christ.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For truly in this city there were gathered together against Your holy servant Jesus, whom You anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, along with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to do whatever Your hand and Your purpose predestined to occur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, Lord, take note of their threats, and grant that Your bond-servants may speak Your word with all confidence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while You extend Your hand to heal, and signs and wonders take place through the name of Your holy servant Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had prayed, the place where they had gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak the word of God with boldness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the congregation of those who believed were of one heart and soul; and not one of them claimed that anything belonging to him was his own, but all things were common property to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with great power the apostles were giving testimony to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and abundant grace was upon them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there was not a needy person among them, for all who were owners of land or houses would sell them and bring the proceeds of the sales
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lay them at the apostles’ feet, and they would be distributed to each as any had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph, a Levite of Cyprian birth, who was also called Barnabas by the apostles (which translated means Son of Encouragement),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and who owned a tract of land, sold it and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a man named Ananias, with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and kept back some of the price for himself, with his wife’s full knowledge, and bringing a portion of it, he laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and to keep back some of the price of the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While it remained unsold, did it not remain your own? And after it was sold, was it not under your control? Why is it that you have conceived this deed in your heart? You have not lied to men but to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he heard these words, Ananias fell down and breathed his last; and great fear came over all who heard of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men got up and covered him up, and after carrying him out, they buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there elapsed an interval of about three hours, and his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter responded to her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for such and such a price?” And she said, “Yes, that was the price.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said to her, “Why is it that you have agreed together to put the Spirit of the Lord to the test? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out as well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately she fell at his feet and breathed her last, and the young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her beside her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great fear came over the whole church, and over all who heard of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were taking place among the people; and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s portico.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But none of the rest dared to associate with them; however, the people held them in high esteem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the more believers in the Lord, multitudes of men and women, were constantly added to their number,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to such an extent that they even carried the sick out into the streets and laid them on cots and pallets, so that when Peter came by at least his shadow might fall on any one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the people from the cities in the vicinity of Jerusalem were coming together, bringing people who were sick or afflicted with unclean spirits, and they were all being healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the high priest rose up, along with all his associates (that is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laid hands on the apostles and put them in a public jail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the gates of the prison, and taking them out he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, stand and speak to the people in the temple the whole message of this Life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon hearing this, they entered into the temple about daybreak and began to teach.
Now when the high priest and his associates came, they called the Council together, even all the Senate of the sons of Israel, and sent orders to the prison house for them to be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the officers who came did not find them in the prison; and they returned and reported back,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “We found the prison house locked quite securely and the guards standing at the doors; but when we had opened up, we found no one inside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests heard these words, they were greatly perplexed about them as to what would come of this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But someone came and reported to them, “The men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the captain went along with the officers and proceeded to bring them back without violence (for they were afraid of the people, that they might be stoned).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had brought them, they stood them before the Council. The high priest questioned them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “We gave you strict orders not to continue teaching in this name, and yet, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you had put to death by hanging Him on a cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one whom God exalted to His right hand as a Prince and a Savior, to grant repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are witnesses of these things; and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they heard this, they were cut to the quick and intended to kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the Law, respected by all the people, stood up in the Council and gave orders to put the men outside for a short time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Men of Israel, take care what you propose to do with these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some time ago Theudas rose up, claiming to be somebody, and a group of about four hundred men joined up with him. But he was killed, and all who followed him were dispersed and came to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the census and drew away some people after him; he too perished, and all those who followed him were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So in the present case, I say to you, stay away from these men and let them alone, for if this plan or action is of men, it will be overthrown;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow them; or else you may even be found fighting against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took his advice; and after calling the apostles in, they flogged them and ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and then released them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went on their way from the presence of the Council, rejoicing that they had been considered worthy to suffer shame for His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every day, in the temple and from house to house, they kept right on teaching and preaching Jesus as the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at this time while the disciples were increasing in number, a complaint arose on the part of the Hellenistic Jews against the native Hebrews, because their widows were being overlooked in the daily serving of food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the twelve summoned the congregation of the disciples and said, “It is not desirable for us to neglect the word of God in order to serve tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brethren, select from among you seven men of good reputation, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may put in charge of this task.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The statement found approval with the whole congregation; and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas and Nicolas, a proselyte from Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these they brought before the apostles; and after praying, they laid their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of God kept on spreading; and the number of the disciples continued to increase greatly in Jerusalem, and a great many of the priests were becoming obedient to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Stephen, full of grace and power, was performing great wonders and signs among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some men from what was called the Synagogue of the Freedmen, including both Cyrenians and Alexandrians, and some from Cilicia and Asia, rose up and argued with Stephen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were unable to cope with the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they secretly induced men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stirred up the people, the elders and the scribes, and they came up to him and dragged him away and brought him before the Council.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put forward false witnesses who said, “This man incessantly speaks against this holy place and the Law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we have heard him say that this Nazarene, Jesus, will destroy this place and alter the customs which Moses handed down to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fixing their gaze on him, all who were sitting in the Council saw his face like the face of an angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest said, “Are these things so?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Hear me, brethren and fathers! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, ‘Leave your country and your relatives, and come into the land that I will show you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. From there, after his father died, God had him move to this country in which you are now living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He gave him no inheritance in it, not even a foot of ground, and yet, even when he had no child, He promised that He would give it to him as a possession, and to his descendants after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God spoke to this effect, that his descendants would be aliens in a foreign land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And whatever nation to which they will be in bondage I Myself will judge,’ said God, ‘and after that they will come out and serve Me in this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He gave him the covenant of circumcision; and so Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him on the eighth day; and Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob of the twelve patriarchs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The patriarchs became jealous of Joseph and sold him into Egypt. Yet God was with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rescued him from all his afflictions, and granted him favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and he made him governor over Egypt and all his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now a famine came over all Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction with it, and our fathers could find no food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers there the first time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second visit Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and Joseph’s family was disclosed to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph sent word and invited Jacob his father and all his relatives to come to him, seventy-five persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob went down to Egypt and there he and our fathers died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they were removed to Shechem and laid in the tomb which Abraham had purchased for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But as the time of the promise was approaching which God had assured to Abraham, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until there arose another king over Egypt who knew nothing about Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was he who took shrewd advantage of our race and mistreated our fathers so that they would expose their infants and they would not survive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was at this time that Moses was born; and he was lovely in the sight of God, and he was nurtured three months in his father’s home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had been set outside, Pharaoh’s daughter took him away and nurtured him as her own son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was educated in all the learning of the Egyptians, and he was a man of power in words and deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he was approaching the age of forty, it entered his mind to visit his brethren, the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw one of them being treated unjustly, he defended him and took vengeance for the oppressed by striking down the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he supposed that his brethren understood that God was granting them deliverance through him, but they did not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the following day he appeared to them as they were fighting together, and he tried to reconcile them in peace, saying, ‘Men, you are brethren, why do you injure one another?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who was injuring his neighbor pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not mean to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday, do you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this remark, Moses fled and became an alien in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in the flame of a burning thorn bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses saw it, he marveled at the sight; and as he approached to look more closely, there came the voice of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.’ Moses shook with fear and would not venture to look.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, ‘Take off the sandals from your feet, for the place on which you are standing is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have certainly seen the oppression of My people in Egypt and have heard their groans, and I have come down to rescue them; come now, and I will send you to Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This Moses whom they disowned, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’ is the one whom God sent to be both a ruler and a deliverer with the help of the angel who appeared to him in the thorn bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man led them out, performing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and in the Red Sea and in the wilderness for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brethren.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the one who was in the congregation in the wilderness together with the angel who was speaking to him on Mount Sinai, and who was with our fathers; and he received living oracles to pass on to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers were unwilling to be obedient to him, but repudiated him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to Aaron, ‘Make for us gods who will go before us; for this Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt—we do not know what happened to him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time they made a calf and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and were rejoicing in the works of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God turned away and delivered them up to serve the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, ‘It was not to Me that you offered victims and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, was it, O house of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also took along the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of the god Rompha, the images which you made to worship. I also will remove you beyond Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of testimony in the wilderness, just as He who spoke to Moses directed him to make it according to the pattern which he had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having received it in their turn, our fathers brought it in with Joshua upon dispossessing the nations whom God drove out before our fathers, until the time of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David found favor in God’s sight, and asked that he might find a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was Solomon who built a house for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the Most High does not dwell in houses made by human hands; as the prophet says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Heaven is My throne,
And earth is the footstool of My feet;
What kind of house will you build for Me?’ says the Lord,
‘Or what place is there for My repose?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Was it not My hand which made all these things?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You men who are stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears are always resisting the Holy Spirit; you are doing just as your fathers did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which one of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? They killed those who had previously announced the coming of the Righteous One, whose betrayers and murderers you have now become;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you who received the law as ordained by angels, and yet did not keep it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the quick, and they began gnashing their teeth at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But being full of the Holy Spirit, he gazed intently into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened up and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they cried out with a loud voice, and covered their ears and rushed at him with one impulse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had driven him out of the city, they began stoning him; and the witnesses laid aside their robes at the feet of a young man named Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went on stoning Stephen as he called on the Lord and said, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then falling on his knees, he cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them!” Having said this, he fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul was in hearty agreement with putting him to death.
And on that day a great persecution began against the church in Jerusalem, and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some devout men buried Stephen, and made loud lamentation over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul began ravaging the church, entering house after house, and dragging off men and women, he would put them in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, those who had been scattered went about preaching the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and began proclaiming Christ to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowds with one accord were giving attention to what was said by Philip, as they heard and saw the signs which he was performing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the case of many who had unclean spirits, they were coming out of them shouting with a loud voice; and many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was much rejoicing in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man named Simon, who formerly was practicing magic in the city and astonishing the people of Samaria, claiming to be someone great;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they all, from smallest to greatest, were giving attention to him, saying, “This man is what is called the Great Power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were giving him attention because he had for a long time astonished them with his magic arts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they believed Philip preaching the good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were being baptized, men and women alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Simon himself believed; and after being baptized, he continued on with Philip, and as he observed signs and great miracles taking place, he was constantly amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent them Peter and John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who came down and prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He had not yet fallen upon any of them; they had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began laying their hands on them, and they were receiving the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Simon saw that the Spirit was bestowed through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Give this authority to me as well, so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have no part or portion in this matter, for your heart is not right before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore repent of this wickedness of yours, and pray the Lord that, if possible, the intention of your heart may be forgiven you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Simon answered and said, “Pray to the Lord for me yourselves, so that nothing of what you have said may come upon me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, when they had solemnly testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they started back to Jerusalem, and were preaching the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip saying, “Get up and go south to the road that descends from Jerusalem to Gaza.” (This is a desert road.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up and went; and there was an Ethiopian eunuch, a court official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of all her treasure; and he had come to Jerusalem to worship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit said to Philip, “Go up and join this chariot.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip ran up and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Well, how could I, unless someone guides me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the passage of Scripture which he was reading was this:
“He was led as a sheep to slaughter;
And as a lamb before its shearer is silent,
So He does not open His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The eunuch answered Philip and said, “Please tell me, of whom does the prophet say this? Of himself or of someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture he preached Jesus to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went along the road they came to some water; and the eunuch said, “Look! Water! What prevents me from being baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [And Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” And he answered and said, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ordered the chariot to stop; and they both went down into the water, Philip as well as the eunuch, and he baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away; and the eunuch no longer saw him, but went on his way rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Philip found himself at Azotus, and as he passed through he kept preaching the gospel to all the cities until he came to Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked for letters from him to the synagogues at Damascus, so that if he found any belonging to the Way, both men and women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was traveling, it happened that he was approaching Damascus, and suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Who are You, Lord?” And He said, “I am Jesus whom you are persecuting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but get up and enter the city, and it will be told you what you must do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who traveled with him stood speechless, hearing the voice but seeing no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul got up from the ground, and though his eyes were open, he could see nothing; and leading him by the hand, they brought him into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was three days without sight, and neither ate nor drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a disciple at Damascus named Ananias; and the Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias.” And he said, “Here I am, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “Get up and go to the street called Straight, and inquire at the house of Judas for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for he is praying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him, so that he might regain his sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much harm he did to Your saints at Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on Your name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Go, for he is a chosen instrument of Mine, to bear My name before the Gentiles and kings and the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will show him how much he must suffer for My name’s sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ananias departed and entered the house, and after laying his hands on him said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road by which you were coming, has sent me so that you may regain your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately there fell from his eyes something like scales, and he regained his sight, and he got up and was baptized;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he took food and was strengthened.
Now for several days he was with the disciples who were at Damascus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and immediately he began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues, saying, “He is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those hearing him continued to be amazed, and were saying, “Is this not he who in Jerusalem destroyed those who called on this name, and who had come here for the purpose of bringing them bound before the chief priests?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul kept increasing in strength and confounding the Jews who lived at Damascus by proving that this Jesus is the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When many days had elapsed, the Jews plotted together to do away with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but their plot became known to Saul. They were also watching the gates day and night so that they might put him to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but his disciples took him by night and let him down through an opening in the wall, lowering him in a large basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to Jerusalem, he was trying to associate with the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Barnabas took hold of him and brought him to the apostles and described to them how he had seen the Lord on the road, and that He had talked to him, and how at Damascus he had spoken out boldly in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was with them, moving about freely in Jerusalem, speaking out boldly in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was talking and arguing with the Hellenistic Jews; but they were attempting to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the brethren learned of it, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the church throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria enjoyed peace, being built up; and going on in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, it continued to increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as Peter was traveling through all those regions, he came down also to the saints who lived at Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There he found a man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden eight years, for he was paralyzed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you; get up and make your bed.” Immediately he got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who lived at Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (which translated in Greek is called Dorcas); this woman was abounding with deeds of kindness and charity which she continually did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened at that time that she fell sick and died; and when they had washed her body, they laid it in an upper room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, having heard that Peter was there, sent two men to him, imploring him, “Do not delay in coming to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter arose and went with them. When he arrived, they brought him into the upper room; and all the widows stood beside him, weeping and showing all the tunics and garments that Dorcas used to make while she was with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter sent them all out and knelt down and prayed, and turning to the body, he said, “Tabitha, arise.” And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave her his hand and raised her up; and calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It became known all over Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter stayed many days in Joppa with a tanner named Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man at Caesarea named Cornelius, a centurion of what was called the Italian cohort,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a devout man and one who feared God with all his household, and gave many alms to the Jewish people and prayed to God continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About the ninth hour of the day he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God who had just come in and said to him, “Cornelius!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fixing his gaze on him and being much alarmed, he said, “What is it, Lord?” And he said to him, “Your prayers and alms have ascended as a memorial before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now dispatch some men to Joppa and send for a man named Simon, who is also called Peter;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is staying with a tanner named Simon, whose house is by the sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angel who was speaking to him had left, he summoned two of his servants and a devout soldier of those who were his personal attendants,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after he had explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, as they were on their way and approaching the city, Peter went up on the housetop about the sixth hour to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he became hungry and was desiring to eat; but while they were making preparations, he fell into a trance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw the sky opened up, and an object like a great sheet coming down, lowered by four corners to the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there were in it all kinds of four-footed animals and crawling creatures of the earth and birds of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice came to him, “Get up, Peter, kill and eat!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “By no means, Lord, for I have never eaten anything unholy and unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again a voice came to him a second time, “What God has cleansed, no longer consider unholy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times, and immediately the object was taken up into the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Peter was greatly perplexed in mind as to what the vision which he had seen might be, behold, the men who had been sent by Cornelius, having asked directions for Simon’s house, appeared at the gate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and calling out, they were asking whether Simon, who was also called Peter, was staying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was reflecting on the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But get up, go downstairs and accompany them without misgivings, for I have sent them Myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter went down to the men and said, “Behold, I am the one you are looking for; what is the reason for which you have come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous and God-fearing man well spoken of by the entire nation of the Jews, was divinely directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and hear a message from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he invited them in and gave them lodging.
And on the next day he got up and went away with them, and some of the brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the following day he entered Caesarea. Now Cornelius was waiting for them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter entered, Cornelius met him, and fell at his feet and worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter raised him up, saying, “Stand up; I too am just a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he talked with him, he entered and found many people assembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “You yourselves know how unlawful it is for a man who is a Jew to associate with a foreigner or to visit him; and yet God has shown me that I should not call any man unholy or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I came without even raising any objection when I was sent for. So I ask for what reason you have sent for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cornelius said, “Four days ago to this hour, I was praying in my house during the ninth hour; and behold, a man stood before me in shining garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your alms have been remembered before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore send to Joppa and invite Simon, who is also called Peter, to come to you; he is staying at the house of Simon the tanner by the sea.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I sent for you immediately, and you have been kind enough to come. Now then, we are all here present before God to hear all that you have been commanded by the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Opening his mouth, Peter said:
“I most certainly understand now that God is not one to show partiality,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in every nation the man who fears Him and does what is right is welcome to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which He sent to the sons of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ (He is Lord of all)—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you yourselves know the thing which took place throughout all Judea, starting from Galilee, after the baptism which John proclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know of Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed Him with the Holy Spirit and with power, and how He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are witnesses of all the things He did both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They also put Him to death by hanging Him on a cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God raised Him up on the third day and granted that He become visible,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to all the people, but to witnesses who were chosen beforehand by God, that is, to us who ate and drank with Him after He arose from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He ordered us to preach to the people, and solemnly to testify that this is the One who has been appointed by God as Judge of the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Him all the prophets bear witness that through His name everyone who believes in Him receives forgiveness of sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all those who were listening to the message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the circumcised believers who came with Peter were amazed, because the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out on the Gentiles also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they were hearing them speaking with tongues and exalting God. Then Peter answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely no one can refuse the water for these to be baptized who have received the Holy Spirit just as we did, can he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ordered them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay on for a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the apostles and the brethren who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter came up to Jerusalem, those who were circumcised took issue with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter began speaking and proceeded to explain to them in orderly sequence, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying; and in a trance I saw a vision, an object coming down like a great sheet lowered by four corners from the sky; and it came right down to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when I had fixed my gaze on it and was observing it I saw the four-footed animals of the earth and the wild beasts and the crawling creatures and the birds of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter; kill and eat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said, ‘By no means, Lord, for nothing unholy or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a voice from heaven answered a second time, ‘What God has cleansed, no longer consider unholy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times, and everything was drawn back up into the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, at that moment three men appeared at the house in which we were staying, having been sent to me from Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit told me to go with them without misgivings. These six brethren also went with me and we entered the man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he reported to us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying, ‘Send to Joppa and have Simon, who is also called Peter, brought here;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will speak words to you by which you will be saved, you and all your household.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them just as He did upon us at the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how He used to say, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if God gave to them the same gift as He gave to us also after believing in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could stand in God’s way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they quieted down and glorified God, saying, “Well then, God has granted to the Gentiles also the repentance that leads to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then those who were scattered because of the persecution that occurred in connection with Stephen made their way to Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except to Jews alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who came to Antioch and began speaking to the Greeks also, preaching the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a large number who believed turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about them reached the ears of the church at Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas off to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when he arrived and witnessed the grace of God, he rejoiced and began to encourage them all with resolute heart to remain true to the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And considerable numbers were brought to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left for Tarsus to look for Saul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. And for an entire year they met with the church and taught considerable numbers; and the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them named Agabus stood up and began to indicate by the Spirit that there would certainly be a great famine all over the world. And this took place in the reign of Claudius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the proportion that any of the disciples had means, each of them determined to send a contribution for the relief of the brethren living in Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this they did, sending it in charge of Barnabas and Saul to the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about that time Herod the king laid hands on some who belonged to the church in order to mistreat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he had James the brother of John put to death with a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also. Now it was during the days of Unleavened Bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had seized him, he put him in prison, delivering him to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending after the Passover to bring him out before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter was kept in the prison, but prayer for him was being made fervently by the church to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the very night when Herod was about to bring him forward, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and guards in front of the door were watching over the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, an angel of the Lord suddenly appeared and a light shone in the cell; and he struck Peter’s side and woke him up, saying, “Get up quickly.” And his chains fell off his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said to him, “Gird yourself and put on your sandals.” And he did so. And he said to him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out and continued to follow, and he did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had passed the first and second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city, which opened for them by itself; and they went out and went along one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I know for sure that the Lord has sent forth His angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John who was also called Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he knocked at the door of the gate, a servant-girl named Rhoda came to answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she recognized Peter’s voice, because of her joy she did not open the gate, but ran in and announced that Peter was standing in front of the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “You are out of your mind!” But she kept insisting that it was so. They kept saying, “It is his angel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter continued knocking; and when they had opened the door, they saw him and were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But motioning to them with his hand to be silent, he described to them how the Lord had led him out of the prison. And he said, “Report these things to James and the brethren.” Then he left and went to another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when day came, there was no small disturbance among the soldiers as to what could have become of Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod had searched for him and had not found him, he examined the guards and ordered that they be led away to execution. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and was spending time there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon; and with one accord they came to him, and having won over Blastus the king’s chamberlain, they were asking for peace, because their country was fed by the king’s country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On an appointed day Herod, having put on his royal apparel, took his seat on the rostrum and began delivering an address to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people kept crying out, “The voice of a god and not of a man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately an angel of the Lord struck him because he did not give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of the Lord continued to grow and to be multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem when they had fulfilled their mission, taking along with them John, who was also called Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were at Antioch, in the church that was there, prophets and teachers: Barnabas, and Simeon who was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were ministering to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they reached Salamis, they began to proclaim the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews; and they also had John as their helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had gone through the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a magician, a Jewish false prophet whose name was Bar-Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of intelligence. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elymas the magician (for so his name is translated) was opposing them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul, who was also known as Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, fixed his gaze on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “You who are full of all deceit and fraud, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease to make crooked the straight ways of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you will be blind and not see the sun for a time.” And immediately a mist and a darkness fell upon him, and he went about seeking those who would lead him by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the proconsul believed when he saw what had happened, being amazed at the teaching of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Paul and his companions put out to sea from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia; but John left them and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But going on from Perga, they arrived at Pisidian Antioch, and on the Sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the reading of the Law and the Prophets the synagogue officials sent to them, saying, “Brethren, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said,
“Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and made the people great during their stay in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm He led them out from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a period of about forty years He put up with them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He distributed their land as an inheritance—all of which took about four hundred and fifty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things He gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After He had removed him, He raised up David to be their king, concerning whom He also testified and said, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after My heart, who will do all My will.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of this man, according to promise, God has brought to Israel a Savior, Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: after John had proclaimed before His coming a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while John was completing his course, he kept saying, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not He. But behold, one is coming after me the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brethren, sons of Abraham’s family, and those among you who fear God, to us the message of this salvation has been sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who live in Jerusalem, and their rulers, recognizing neither Him nor the utterances of the prophets which are read every Sabbath, fulfilled these by condemning Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though they found no ground for putting Him to death, they asked Pilate that He be executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had carried out all that was written concerning Him, they took Him down from the cross and laid Him in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised Him from the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for many days He appeared to those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, the very ones who are now His witnesses to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we preach to you the good news of the promise made to the fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that God has fulfilled this promise to our children in that He raised up Jesus, as it is also written in the second Psalm, ‘You are My Son; today i have begotten You.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the fact that He raised Him up from the dead, no longer to return to decay, He has spoken in this way: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore He also says in another Psalm, ‘You will not allow Your Holy One to undergo decay.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David, after he had served the purpose of God in his own generation, fell asleep, and was laid among his fathers and underwent decay;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but He whom God raised did not undergo decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let it be known to you, brethren, that through Him forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and through Him everyone who believes is freed from all things, from which you could not be freed through the Law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore take heed, so that the thing spoken of in the Prophets may not come upon you:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: As Paul and Barnabas were going out, the people kept begging that these things might be spoken to them the next Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the meeting of the synagogue had broken up, many of the Jews and of the God-fearing proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, were urging them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next Sabbath nearly the whole city assembled to hear the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy and began contradicting the things spoken by Paul, and were blaspheming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly and said, “It was necessary that the word of God be spoken to you first; since you repudiate it and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we are turning to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For so the Lord has commanded us,
‘I have placed You as a light for the Gentiles,
That You may bring salvation to the end of the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Gentiles heard this, they began rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord; and as many as had been appointed to eternal life believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord was being spread through the whole region.
verses.speaker: Narrator
