verses.text: But the Jews incited the devout women of prominence and the leading men of the city, and instigated a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out of their district.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shook off the dust of their feet in protest against them and went to Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples were continually filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Iconium they entered the synagogue of the Jews together, and spoke in such a manner that a large number of people believed, both of Jews and of Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews who disbelieved stirred up the minds of the Gentiles and embittered them against the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they spent a long time there speaking boldly with reliance upon the Lord, who was testifying to the word of His grace, granting that signs and wonders be done by their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of the city were divided; and some sided with the Jews, and some with the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when an attempt was made by both the Gentiles and the Jews with their rulers, to mistreat and to stone them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they became aware of it and fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the surrounding region;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there they continued to preach the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Lystra a man was sitting who had no strength in his feet, lame from his mother’s womb, who had never walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man was listening to Paul as he spoke, who, when he had fixed his gaze on him and had seen that he had faith to be made well,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet.” And he leaped up and began to walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they raised their voice, saying in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have become like men and have come down to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began calling Barnabas, Zeus, and Paul, Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, and wanted to offer sacrifice with the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of it, they tore their robes and rushed out into the crowd, crying out
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? We are also men of the same nature as you, and preach the gospel to you that you should turn from these vain things to a living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all that is in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the generations gone by He permitted all the nations to go their own ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and yet He did not leave Himself without witness, in that He did good and gave you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying your hearts with food and gladness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even saying these things, with difficulty they restrained the crowds from offering sacrifice to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium, and having won over the crowds, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing him to be dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while the disciples stood around him, he got up and entered the city. The next day he went away with Barnabas to Derbe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had preached the gospel to that city and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and saying, “Through many tribulations we must enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had appointed elders for them in every church, having prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They passed through Pisidia and came into Pamphylia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they sailed to Antioch, from which they had been commended to the grace of God for the work that they had accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had arrived and gathered the church together, they began to report all things that God had done with them and how He had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spent a long time with the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men came down from Judea and began teaching the brethren, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul and Barnabas had great dissension and debate with them, the brethren determined that Paul and Barnabas and some others of them should go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders concerning this issue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, being sent on their way by the church, they were passing through both Phoenicia and Samaria, describing in detail the conversion of the Gentiles, and were bringing great joy to all the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived at Jerusalem, they were received by the church and the apostles and the elders, and they reported all that God had done with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the sect of the Pharisees who had believed stood up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them and to direct them to observe the Law of Moses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles and the elders came together to look into this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After there had been much debate, Peter stood up and said to them, “Brethren, you know that in the early days God made a choice among you, that by my mouth the Gentiles would hear the word of the gospel and believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God, who knows the heart, testified to them giving them the Holy Spirit, just as He also did to us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore why do you put God to the test by placing upon the neck of the disciples a yoke which neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus, in the same way as they also are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people kept silent, and they were listening to Barnabas and Paul as they were relating what signs and wonders God had done through them among the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had stopped speaking, James answered, saying, “Brethren, listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon has related how God first concerned Himself about taking from among the Gentiles a people for His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With this the words of the Prophets agree, just as it is written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘After these things I will return,
And I will rebuild the tabernacle of David which has fallen,
And I will rebuild its ruins,
And I will restore it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that the rest of mankind may seek the Lord,
And all the Gentiles who are called by My name,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Says the Lord, who makes these things known from long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is my judgment that we do not trouble those who are turning to God from among the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but that we write to them that they abstain from things contaminated by idols and from fornication and from what is strangled and from blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses from ancient generations has in every city those who preach him, since he is read in the synagogues every Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole church, to choose men from among them to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas—Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, leading men among the brethren,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they sent this letter by them,
“The apostles and the brethren who are elders, to the brethren in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia who are from the Gentiles, greetings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Since we have heard that some of our number to whom we gave no instruction have disturbed you with their words, unsettling your souls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good to us, having become of one mind, to select men to send to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore we have sent Judas and Silas, who themselves will also report the same things by word of mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to lay upon you no greater burden than these essentials:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols and from blood and from things strangled and from fornication; if you keep yourselves free from such things, you will do well. Farewell.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they were sent away, they went down to Antioch; and having gathered the congregation together, they delivered the letter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had read it, they rejoiced because of its encouragement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas and Silas, also being prophets themselves, encouraged and strengthened the brethren with a lengthy message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had spent time there, they were sent away from the brethren in peace to those who had sent them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [But it seemed good to Silas to remain there.]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch, teaching and preaching with many others also, the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us return and visit the brethren in every city in which we proclaimed the word of the Lord, and see how they are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barnabas wanted to take John, called Mark, along with them also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul kept insisting that they should not take him along who had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not gone with them to the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there occurred such a sharp disagreement that they separated from one another, and Barnabas took Mark with him and sailed away to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul chose Silas and left, being committed by the brethren to the grace of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was traveling through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul came also to Derbe and to Lystra. And a disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a Jewish woman who was a believer, but his father was a Greek,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was well spoken of by the brethren who were in Lystra and Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul wanted this man to go with him; and he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those parts, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were passing through the cities, they were delivering the decrees which had been decided upon by the apostles and elders who were in Jerusalem, for them to observe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the churches were being strengthened in the faith, and were increasing in number daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They passed through the Phrygian and Galatian region, having been forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after they came to Mysia, they were trying to go into Bithynia, and the Spirit of Jesus did not permit them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A vision appeared to Paul in the night: a man of Macedonia was standing and appealing to him, and saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So putting out to sea from Troas, we ran a straight course to Samothrace, and on the day following to Neapolis;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from there to Philippi, which is a leading city of the district of Macedonia, a Roman colony; and we were staying in this city for some days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the Sabbath day we went outside the gate to a riverside, where we were supposing that there would be a place of prayer; and we sat down and began speaking to the women who had assembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman named Lydia, from the city of Thyatira, a seller of purple fabrics, a worshiper of God, was listening; and the Lord opened her heart to respond to the things spoken by Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she and her household had been baptized, she urged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house and stay.” And she prevailed upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that as we were going to the place of prayer, a slave-girl having a spirit of divination met us, who was bringing her masters much profit by fortune-telling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Following after Paul and us, she kept crying out, saying, “These men are bond-servants of the Most High God, who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She continued doing this for many days. But Paul was greatly annoyed, and turned and said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her!” And it came out at that very moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when her masters saw that their hope of profit was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the market place before the authorities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they had brought them to the chief magistrates, they said, “These men are throwing our city into confusion, being Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and are proclaiming customs which it is not lawful for us to accept or to observe, being Romans.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd rose up together against them, and the chief magistrates tore their robes off them and proceeded to order them to be beaten with rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had struck them with many blows, they threw them into prison, commanding the jailer to guard them securely;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he, having received such a command, threw them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns of praise to God, and the prisoners were listening to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and suddenly there came a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison house were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s chains were unfastened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the jailer awoke and saw the prison doors opened, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called for lights and rushed in, and trembling with fear he fell down before Paul and Silas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after he brought them out, he said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spoke the word of the Lord to him together with all who were in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took them that very hour of the night and washed their wounds, and immediately he was baptized, he and all his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought them into his house and set food before them, and rejoiced greatly, having believed in God with his whole household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when day came, the chief magistrates sent their policemen, saying, “Release those men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the jailer reported these words to Paul, saying, “The chief magistrates have sent to release you. Therefore come out now and go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said to them, “They have beaten us in public without trial, men who are Romans, and have thrown us into prison; and now are they sending us away secretly? No indeed! But let them come themselves and bring us out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The policemen reported these words to the chief magistrates. They were afraid when they heard that they were Romans,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they came and appealed to them, and when they had brought them out, they kept begging them to leave the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out of the prison and entered the house of Lydia, and when they saw the brethren, they encouraged them and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And according to Paul’s custom, he went to them, and for three Sabbaths reasoned with them from the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: explaining and giving evidence that the Christ had to suffer and rise again from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus whom I am proclaiming to you is the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, along with a large number of the God-fearing Greeks and a number of the leading women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews, becoming jealous and taking along some wicked men from the market place, formed a mob and set the city in an uproar; and attacking the house of Jason, they were seeking to bring them out to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they did not find them, they began dragging Jason and some brethren before the city authorities, shouting, “These men who have upset the world have come here also;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jason has welcomed them, and they all act contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stirred up the crowd and the city authorities who heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had received a pledge from Jason and the others, they released them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The brethren immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Berea, and when they arrived, they went into the synagogue of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these were more noble-minded than those in Thessalonica, for they received the word with great eagerness, examining the Scriptures daily to see whether these things were so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore many of them believed, along with a number of prominent Greek women and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica found out that the word of God had been proclaimed by Paul in Berea also, they came there as well, agitating and stirring up the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then immediately the brethren sent Paul out to go as far as the sea; and Silas and Timothy remained there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who escorted Paul brought him as far as Athens; and receiving a command for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible, they left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Paul was waiting for them at Athens, his spirit was being provoked within him as he was observing the city full of idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he was reasoning in the synagogue with the Jews and the God-fearing Gentiles, and in the market place every day with those who happened to be present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were conversing with him. Some were saying, “What would this idle babbler wish to say?” Others, “He seems to be a proclaimer of strange deities,”—because he was preaching Jesus and the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took him and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, “May we know what this new teaching is which you are proclaiming?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are bringing some strange things to our ears; so we want to know what these things mean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now all the Athenians and the strangers visiting there used to spend their time in nothing other than telling or hearing something new.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul stood in the midst of the Areopagus and said, “Men of Athens, I observe that you are very religious in all respects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For while I was passing through and examining the objects of your worship, I also found an altar with this inscription, ‘TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.’ Therefore what you worship in ignorance, this I proclaim to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God who made the world and all things in it, since He is Lord of heaven and earth, does not dwell in temples made with hands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor is He served by human hands, as though He needed anything, since He Himself gives to all people life and breath and all things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He made from one man every nation of mankind to live on all the face of the earth, having determined their appointed times and the boundaries of their habitation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they would seek God, if perhaps they might grope for Him and find Him, though He is not far from each one of us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in Him we live and move and exist, as even some of your own poets have said, ‘For we also are His children.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being then the children of God, we ought not to think that the Divine Nature is like gold or silver or stone, an image formed by the art and thought of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore having overlooked the times of ignorance, God is now declaring to men that all people everywhere should repent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because He has fixed a day in which He will judge the world in righteousness through a Man whom He has appointed, having furnished proof to all men by raising Him from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some began to sneer, but others said, “We shall hear you again concerning this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul went out of their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some men joined him and believed, among whom also were Dionysius the Areopagite and a woman named Damaris and others with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things he left Athens and went to Corinth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he found a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, having recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to leave Rome. He came to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because he was of the same trade, he stayed with them and they were working, for by trade they were tent-makers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was reasoning in the synagogue every Sabbath and trying to persuade Jews and Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul began devoting himself completely to the word, solemnly testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they resisted and blasphemed, he shook out his garments and said to them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am clean. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he left there and went to the house of a man named Titius Justus, a worshiper of God, whose house was next to the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crispus, the leader of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his household, and many of the Corinthians when they heard were believing and being baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Paul in the night by a vision, “Do not be afraid any longer, but go on speaking and do not be silent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I am with you, and no man will attack you in order to harm you, for I have many people in this city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he settled there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, “If it were a matter of wrong or of vicious crime, O Jews, it would be reasonable for me to put up with you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if there are questions about words and names and your own law, look after it yourselves; I am unwilling to be a judge of these matters.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he drove them away from the judgment seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all took hold of Sosthenes, the leader of the synagogue, and began beating him in front of the judgment seat. But Gallio was not concerned about any of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul, having remained many days longer, took leave of the brethren and put out to sea for Syria, and with him were Priscilla and Aquila. In Cenchrea he had his hair cut, for he was keeping a vow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Ephesus, and he left them there. Now he himself entered the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they asked him to stay for a longer time, he did not consent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but taking leave of them and saying, “I will return to you again if God wills,” he set sail from Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church, and went down to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having spent some time there, he left and passed successively through the Galatian region and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by birth, an eloquent man, came to Ephesus; and he was mighty in the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he was speaking and teaching accurately the things concerning Jesus, being acquainted only with the baptism of John;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he began to speak out boldly in the synagogue. But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside and explained to him the way of God more accurately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he wanted to go across to Achaia, the brethren encouraged him and wrote to the disciples to welcome him; and when he had arrived, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he powerfully refuted the Jews in public, demonstrating by the Scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul passed through the upper country and came to Ephesus, and found some disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?” And they said to him, “No, we have not even heard whether there is a Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Into what then were you baptized?” And they said, “Into John’s baptism.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul said, “John baptized with the baptism of repentance, telling the people to believe in Him who was coming after him, that is, in Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they began speaking with tongues and prophesying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were in all about twelve men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered the synagogue and continued speaking out boldly for three months, reasoning and persuading them about the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when some were becoming hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the people, he withdrew from them and took away the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This took place for two years, so that all who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord, both Jews and Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God was performing extraordinary miracles by the hands of Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that handkerchiefs or aprons were even carried from his body to the sick, and the diseases left them and the evil spirits went out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But also some of the Jewish exorcists, who went from place to place, attempted to name over those who had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, “I adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven sons of one Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, were doing this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the evil spirit answered and said to them, “I recognize Jesus, and I know about Paul, but who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man, in whom was the evil spirit, leaped on them and subdued all of them and overpowered them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, who lived in Ephesus; and fear fell upon them all and the name of the Lord Jesus was being magnified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many also of those who had believed kept coming, confessing and disclosing their practices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of those who practiced magic brought their books together and began burning them in the sight of everyone; and they counted up the price of them and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the word of the Lord was growing mightily and prevailing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after these things were finished, Paul purposed in the Spirit to go to Jerusalem after he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, saying, “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having sent into Macedonia two of those who ministered to him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About that time there occurred no small disturbance concerning the Way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Artemis, was bringing no little business to the craftsmen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these he gathered together with the workmen of similar trades, and said, “Men, you know that our prosperity depends upon this business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see and hear that not only in Ephesus, but in almost all of Asia, this Paul has persuaded and turned away a considerable number of people, saying that gods made with hands are no gods at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not only is there danger that this trade of ours fall into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis be regarded as worthless and that she whom all of Asia and the world worship will even be dethroned from her magnificence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this and were filled with rage, they began crying out, saying, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city was filled with the confusion, and they rushed with one accord into the theater, dragging along Gaius and Aristarchus, Paul’s traveling companions from Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul wanted to go into the assembly, the disciples would not let him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also some of the Asiarchs who were friends of his sent to him and repeatedly urged him not to venture into the theater.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, some were shouting one thing and some another, for the assembly was in confusion and the majority did not know for what reason they had come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the crowd concluded it was Alexander, since the Jews had put him forward; and having motioned with his hand, Alexander was intending to make a defense to the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they recognized that he was a Jew, a single outcry arose from them all as they shouted for about two hours, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After quieting the crowd, the town clerk said, “Men of Ephesus, what man is there after all who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of the image which fell down from heaven?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, since these are undeniable facts, you ought to keep calm and to do nothing rash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have brought these men here who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of our goddess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, if Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a complaint against any man, the courts are in session and proconsuls are available; let them bring charges against one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you want anything beyond this, it shall be settled in the lawful assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed we are in danger of being accused of a riot in connection with today’s events, since there is no real cause for it, and in this connection we will be unable to account for this disorderly gathering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this he dismissed the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the uproar had ceased, Paul sent for the disciples, and when he had exhorted them and taken his leave of them, he left to go to Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone through those districts and had given them much exhortation, he came to Greece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there he spent three months, and when a plot was formed against him by the Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria, he decided to return through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was accompanied by Sopater of Berea, the son of Pyrrhus, and by Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians, and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy, and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these had gone on ahead and were waiting for us at Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We sailed from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread, and came to them at Troas within five days; and there we stayed seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the week, when we were gathered together to break bread, Paul began talking to them, intending to leave the next day, and he prolonged his message until midnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were many lamps in the upper room where we were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a young man named Eutychus sitting on the window sill, sinking into a deep sleep; and as Paul kept on talking, he was overcome by sleep and fell down from the third floor and was picked up dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul went down and fell upon him, and after embracing him, he said, “Do not be troubled, for his life is in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone back up and had broken the bread and eaten, he talked with them a long while until daybreak, and then left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took away the boy alive, and were greatly comforted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we, going ahead to the ship, set sail for Assos, intending from there to take Paul on board; for so he had arranged it, intending himself to go by land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he met us at Assos, we took him on board and came to Mitylene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sailing from there, we arrived the following day opposite Chios; and the next day we crossed over to Samos; and the day following we came to Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus so that he would not have to spend time in Asia; for he was hurrying to be in Jerusalem, if possible, on the day of Pentecost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Miletus he sent to Ephesus and called to him the elders of the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when they had come to him, he said to them,
“You yourselves know, from the first day that I set foot in Asia, how I was with you the whole time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: serving the Lord with all humility and with tears and with trials which came upon me through the plots of the Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how I did not shrink from declaring to you anything that was profitable, and teaching you publicly and from house to house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: solemnly testifying to both Jews and Greeks of repentance toward God and faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, behold, bound by the Spirit, I am on my way to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except that the Holy Spirit solemnly testifies to me in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions await me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I do not consider my life of any account as dear to myself, so that I may finish my course and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify solemnly of the gospel of the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, behold, I know that all of you, among whom I went about preaching the kingdom, will no longer see my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I testify to you this day that I am innocent of the blood of all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I did not shrink from declaring to you the whole purpose of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on guard for yourselves and for all the flock, among which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the church of God which He purchased with His own blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that after my departure savage wolves will come in among you, not sparing the flock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from among your own selves men will arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be on the alert, remembering that night and day for a period of three years I did not cease to admonish each one with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I commend you to God and to the word of His grace, which is able to build you up and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have coveted no one’s silver or gold or clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You yourselves know that these hands ministered to my own needs and to the men who were with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In everything I showed you that by working hard in this manner you must help the weak and remember the words of the Lord Jesus, that He Himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to weep aloud and embraced Paul, and repeatedly kissed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: grieving especially over the word which he had spoken, that they would not see his face again. And they were accompanying him to the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we had parted from them and had set sail, we ran a straight course to Cos and the next day to Rhodes and from there to Patara;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard and set sail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we came in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left, we kept sailing to Syria and landed at Tyre; for there the ship was to unload its cargo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After looking up the disciples, we stayed there seven days; and they kept telling Paul through the Spirit not to set foot in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When our days there were ended, we left and started on our journey, while they all, with wives and children, escorted us until we were out of the city. After kneeling down on the beach and praying, we said farewell to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais, and after greeting the brethren, we stayed with them for a day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day we left and came to Caesarea, and entering the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, we stayed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this man had four virgin daughters who were prophetesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we were staying there for some days, a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And coming to us, he took Paul’s belt and bound his own feet and hands, and said, “This is what the Holy Spirit says: ‘In this way the Jews at Jerusalem will bind the man who owns this belt and deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we had heard this, we as well as the local residents began begging him not to go up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul answered, “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but even to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since he would not be persuaded, we fell silent, remarking, “The will of the Lord be done!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these days we got ready and started on our way up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the disciples from Caesarea also came with us, taking us to Mnason of Cyprus, a disciple of long standing with whom we were to lodge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After we arrived in Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the following day Paul went in with us to James, and all the elders were present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had greeted them, he began to relate one by one the things which God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard it they began glorifying God; and they said to him, “You see, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed, and they are all zealous for the Law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have been told about you, that you are teaching all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children nor to walk according to the customs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What, then, is to be done? They will certainly hear that you have come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do this that we tell you. We have four men who are under a vow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take them and purify yourself along with them, and pay their expenses so that they may shave their heads; and all will know that there is nothing to the things which they have been told about you, but that you yourself also walk orderly, keeping the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning the Gentiles who have believed, we wrote, having decided that they should abstain from meat sacrificed to idols and from blood and from what is strangled and from fornication.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purifying himself along with them, went into the temple giving notice of the completion of the days of purification, until the sacrifice was offered for each one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the seven days were almost over, the Jews from Asia, upon seeing him in the temple, began to stir up all the crowd and laid hands on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: crying out, “Men of Israel, come to our aid! This is the man who preaches to all men everywhere against our people and the Law and this place; and besides he has even brought Greeks into the temple and has defiled this holy place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him, and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the city was provoked, and the people rushed together, and taking hold of Paul they dragged him out of the temple, and immediately the doors were shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were seeking to kill him, a report came up to the commander of the Roman cohort that all Jerusalem was in confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once he took along some soldiers and centurions and ran down to them; and when they saw the commander and the soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the commander came up and took hold of him, and ordered him to be bound with two chains; and he began asking who he was and what he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But among the crowd some were shouting one thing and some another, and when he could not find out the facts because of the uproar, he ordered him to be brought into the barracks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he got to the stairs, he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the mob;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the multitude of the people kept following them, shouting, “Away with him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he said to the commander, “May I say something to you?” And he said, “Do you know Greek?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are not the Egyptian who some time ago stirred up a revolt and led the four thousand men of the Assassins out into the wilderness?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am a Jew of Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city; and I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had given him permission, Paul, standing on the stairs, motioned to the people with his hand; and when there was a great hush, he spoke to them in the Hebrew dialect, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brethren and fathers, hear my defense which I now offer to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard that he was addressing them in the Hebrew dialect, they became even more quiet; and he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city, educated under Gamaliel, strictly according to the law of our fathers, being zealous for God just as you all are today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and putting both men and women into prisons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as also the high priest and all the Council of the elders can testify. From them I also received letters to the brethren, and started off for Damascus in order to bring even those who were there to Jerusalem as prisoners to be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But it happened that as I was on my way, approaching Damascus about noontime, a very bright light suddenly flashed from heaven all around me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I answered, ‘Who are You, Lord?’ And He said to me, ‘I am Jesus the Nazarene, whom you are persecuting.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were with me saw the light, to be sure, but did not understand the voice of the One who was speaking to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ And the Lord said to me, ‘Get up and go on into Damascus, and there you will be told of all that has been appointed for you to do.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since I could not see because of the brightness of that light, I was led by the hand by those who were with me and came into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A certain Ananias, a man who was devout by the standard of the Law, and well spoken of by all the Jews who lived there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came to me, and standing near said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ And at that very time I looked up at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know His will and to see the Righteous One and to hear an utterance from His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you will be a witness for Him to all men of what you have seen and heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now why do you delay? Get up and be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on His name.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It happened when I returned to Jerusalem and was praying in the temple, that I fell into a trance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I saw Him saying to me, ‘Make haste, and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not accept your testimony about Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘Lord, they themselves understand that in one synagogue after another I used to imprison and beat those who believed in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the blood of Your witness Stephen was being shed, I also was standing by approving, and watching out for the coats of those who were slaying him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, ‘Go! For I will send you far away to the Gentiles.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They listened to him up to this statement, and then they raised their voices and said, “Away with such a fellow from the earth, for he should not be allowed to live!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were crying out and throwing off their cloaks and tossing dust into the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the commander ordered him to be brought into the barracks, stating that he should be examined by scourging so that he might find out the reason why they were shouting against him that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they stretched him out with thongs, Paul said to the centurion who was standing by, “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman and uncondemned?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion heard this, he went to the commander and told him, saying, “What are you about to do? For this man is a Roman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The commander came and said to him, “Tell me, are you a Roman?” And he said, “Yes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The commander answered, “I acquired this citizenship with a large sum of money.” And Paul said, “But I was actually born a citizen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore those who were about to examine him immediately let go of him; and the commander also was afraid when he found out that he was a Roman, and because he had put him in chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the next day, wishing to know for certain why he had been accused by the Jews, he released him and ordered the chief priests and all the Council to assemble, and brought Paul down and set him before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul, looking intently at the Council, said, “Brethren, I have lived my life with a perfectly good conscience before God up to this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest Ananias commanded those standing beside him to strike him on the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul said to him, “God is going to strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit to try me according to the Law, and in violation of the Law order me to be struck?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the bystanders said, “Do you revile God’s high priest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul said, “I was not aware, brethren, that he was high priest; for it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But perceiving that one group were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, Paul began crying out in the Council, “Brethren, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees; I am on trial for the hope and resurrection of the dead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said this, there occurred a dissension between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, nor an angel, nor a spirit, but the Pharisees acknowledge them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there occurred a great uproar; and some of the scribes of the Pharisaic party stood up and began to argue heatedly, saying, “We find nothing wrong with this man; suppose a spirit or an angel has spoken to him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as a great dissension was developing, the commander was afraid Paul would be torn to pieces by them and ordered the troops to go down and take him away from them by force, and bring him into the barracks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the night immediately following, the Lord stood at his side and said, “Take courage; for as you have solemnly witnessed to My cause at Jerusalem, so you must witness at Rome also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was day, the Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves under an oath, saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were more than forty who formed this plot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the chief priests and the elders and said, “We have bound ourselves under a solemn oath to taste nothing until we have killed Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, you and the Council notify the commander to bring him down to you, as though you were going to determine his case by a more thorough investigation; and we for our part are ready to slay him before he comes near the place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the son of Paul’s sister heard of their ambush, and he came and entered the barracks and told Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul called one of the centurions to him and said, “Lead this young man to the commander, for he has something to report to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he took him and led him to the commander and said, “Paul the prisoner called me to him and asked me to lead this young man to you since he has something to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The commander took him by the hand and stepping aside, began to inquire of him privately, “What is it that you have to report to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down tomorrow to the Council, as though they were going to inquire somewhat more thoroughly about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not listen to them, for more than forty of them are lying in wait for him who have bound themselves under a curse not to eat or drink until they slay him; and now they are ready and waiting for the promise from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the commander let the young man go, instructing him, “Tell no one that you have notified me of these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called to him two of the centurions and said, “Get two hundred soldiers ready by the third hour of the night to proceed to Caesarea, with seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were also to provide mounts to put Paul on and bring him safely to Felix the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he wrote a letter having this form:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Claudius Lysias, to the most excellent governor Felix, greetings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When this man was arrested by the Jews and was about to be slain by them, I came up to them with the troops and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And wanting to ascertain the charge for which they were accusing him, I brought him down to their Council;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I found him to be accused over questions about their Law, but under no accusation deserving death or imprisonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When I was informed that there would be a plot against the man, I sent him to you at once, also instructing his accusers to bring charges against him before you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers, in accordance with their orders, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the next day, leaving the horsemen to go on with him, they returned to the barracks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When these had come to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had read it, he asked from what province he was, and when he learned that he was from Cilicia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said, “I will give you a hearing after your accusers arrive also,” giving orders for him to be kept in Herod’s Praetorium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After five days the high priest Ananias came down with some elders, with an attorney named Tertullus, and they brought charges to the governor against Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After Paul had been summoned, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying to the governor,
“Since we have through you attained much peace, and since by your providence reforms are being carried out for this nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we acknowledge this in every way and everywhere, most excellent Felix, with all thankfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, that I may not weary you any further, I beg you to grant us, by your kindness, a brief hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have found this man a real pest and a fellow who stirs up dissension among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he even tried to desecrate the temple; and then we arrested him. [We wanted to judge him according to our own Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Lysias the commander came along, and with much violence took him out of our hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ordering his accusers to come before you.] By examining him yourself concerning all these matters you will be able to ascertain the things of which we accuse him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews also joined in the attack, asserting that these things were so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the governor had nodded for him to speak, Paul responded:
“Knowing that for many years you have been a judge to this nation, I cheerfully make my defense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since you can take note of the fact that no more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither in the temple, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city itself did they find me carrying on a discussion with anyone or causing a riot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor can they prove to you the charges of which they now accuse me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this I admit to you, that according to the Way which they call a sect I do serve the God of our fathers, believing everything that is in accordance with the Law and that is written in the Prophets;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a hope in God, which these men cherish themselves, that there shall certainly be a resurrection of both the righteous and the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In view of this, I also do my best to maintain always a blameless conscience both before God and before men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after several years I came to bring alms to my nation and to present offerings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which they found me occupied in the temple, having been purified, without any crowd or uproar. But there were some Jews from Asia—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who ought to have been present before you and to make accusation, if they should have anything against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else let these men themselves tell what misdeed they found when I stood before the Council,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: other than for this one statement which I shouted out while standing among them, ‘For the resurrection of the dead I am on trial before you today.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Felix, having a more exact knowledge about the Way, put them off, saying, “When Lysias the commander comes down, I will decide your case.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he gave orders to the centurion for him to be kept in custody and yet have some freedom, and not to prevent any of his friends from ministering to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some days later Felix arrived with Drusilla, his wife who was a Jewess, and sent for Paul and heard him speak about faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as he was discussing righteousness, self-control and the judgment to come, Felix became frightened and said, “Go away for the present, and when I find time I will summon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time too, he was hoping that money would be given him by Paul; therefore he also used to send for him quite often and converse with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after two years had passed, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus, and wishing to do the Jews a favor, Felix left Paul imprisoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Festus then, having arrived in the province, three days later went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the leading men of the Jews brought charges against Paul, and they were urging him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: requesting a concession against Paul, that he might have him brought to Jerusalem (at the same time, setting an ambush to kill him on the way).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Festus then answered that Paul was being kept in custody at Caesarea and that he himself was about to leave shortly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore,” he said, “let the influential men among you go there with me, and if there is anything wrong about the man, let them prosecute him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had spent not more than eight or ten days among them, he went down to Caesarea, and on the next day he took his seat on the tribunal and ordered Paul to be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Paul arrived, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing many and serious charges against him which they could not prove,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while Paul said in his own defense, “I have committed no offense either against the Law of the Jews or against the temple or against Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Festus, wishing to do the Jews a favor, answered Paul and said, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and stand trial before me on these charges?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am standing before Caesar’s tribunal, where I ought to be tried. I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also very well know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, then, I am a wrongdoer and have committed anything worthy of death, I do not refuse to die; but if none of those things is true of which these men accuse me, no one can hand me over to them. I appeal to Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Festus had conferred with his council, he answered, “You have appealed to Caesar, to Caesar you shall go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when several days had elapsed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea and paid their respects to Festus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were spending many days there, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying, “There is a man who was left as a prisoner by Felix;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews brought charges against him, asking for a sentence of condemnation against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I answered them that it is not the custom of the Romans to hand over any man before the accused meets his accusers face to face and has an opportunity to make his defense against the charges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after they had assembled here, I did not delay, but on the next day took my seat on the tribunal and ordered the man to be brought before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the accusers stood up, they began bringing charges against him not of such crimes as I was expecting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they simply had some points of disagreement with him about their own religion and about a dead man, Jesus, whom Paul asserted to be alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being at a loss how to investigate such matters, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there stand trial on these matters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul appealed to be held in custody for the Emperor’s decision, I ordered him to be kept in custody until I send him to Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Agrippa said to Festus, “I also would like to hear the man myself.” “Tomorrow,” he said, “you shall hear him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, on the next day when Agrippa came together with Bernice amid great pomp, and entered the auditorium accompanied by the commanders and the prominent men of the city, at the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Festus said, “King Agrippa, and all you gentlemen here present with us, you see this man about whom all the people of the Jews appealed to me, both at Jerusalem and here, loudly declaring that he ought not to live any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death; and since he himself appealed to the Emperor, I decided to send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I have nothing definite about him to write to my lord. Therefore I have brought him before you all and especially before you, King Agrippa, so that after the investigation has taken place, I may have something to write.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it seems absurd to me in sending a prisoner, not to indicate also the charges against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Agrippa said to Paul, “You are permitted to speak for yourself.” Then Paul stretched out his hand and proceeded to make his defense:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In regard to all the things of which I am accused by the Jews, I consider myself fortunate, King Agrippa, that I am about to make my defense before you today;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: especially because you are an expert in all customs and questions among the Jews; therefore I beg you to listen to me patiently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So then, all Jews know my manner of life from my youth up, which from the beginning was spent among my own nation and at Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since they have known about me for a long time, if they are willing to testify, that I lived as a Pharisee according to the strictest sect of our religion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I am standing trial for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the promise to which our twelve tribes hope to attain, as they earnestly serve God night and day. And for this hope, O King, I am being accused by Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is it considered incredible among you people if God does raise the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So then, I thought to myself that I had to do many things hostile to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is just what I did in Jerusalem; not only did I lock up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests, but also when they were being put to death I cast my vote against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I punished them often in all the synagogues, I tried to force them to blaspheme; and being furiously enraged at them, I kept pursuing them even to foreign cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “While so engaged as I was journeying to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at midday, O King, I saw on the way a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, shining all around me and those who were journeying with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had all fallen to the ground, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew dialect, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘Who are You, Lord?’ And the Lord said, ‘I am Jesus whom you are persecuting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But get up and stand on your feet; for this purpose I have appeared to you, to appoint you a minister and a witness not only to the things which you have seen, but also to the things in which I will appear to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rescuing you from the Jewish people and from the Gentiles, to whom I am sending you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to open their eyes so that they may turn from darkness to light and from the dominion of Satan to God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins and an inheritance among those who have been sanctified by faith in Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So, King Agrippa, I did not prove disobedient to the heavenly vision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but kept declaring both to those of Damascus first, and also at Jerusalem and then throughout all the region of Judea, and even to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, performing deeds appropriate to repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason some Jews seized me in the temple and tried to put me to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, having obtained help from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great, stating nothing but what the Prophets and Moses said was going to take place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Christ was to suffer, and that by reason of His resurrection from the dead He would be the first to proclaim light both to the Jewish people and to the Gentiles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Paul was saying this in his defense, Festus said in a loud voice, “Paul, you are out of your mind! Your great learning is driving you mad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am not out of my mind, most excellent Festus, but I utter words of sober truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king knows about these matters, and I speak to him also with confidence, since I am persuaded that none of these things escape his notice; for this has not been done in a corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Agrippa, do you believe the Prophets? I know that you do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Agrippa replied to Paul, “In a short time you will persuade me to become a Christian.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul said, “I would wish to God, that whether in a short or long time, not only you, but also all who hear me this day, might become such as I am, except for these chains.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king stood up and the governor and Bernice, and those who were sitting with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they had gone aside, they began talking to one another, saying, “This man is not doing anything worthy of death or imprisonment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Agrippa said to Festus, “This man might have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was decided that we would sail for Italy, they proceeded to deliver Paul and some other prisoners to a centurion of the Augustan cohort named Julius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And embarking in an Adramyttian ship, which was about to sail to the regions along the coast of Asia, we put out to sea accompanied by Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day we put in at Sidon; and Julius treated Paul with consideration and allowed him to go to his friends and receive care.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there we put out to sea and sailed under the shelter of Cyprus because the winds were contrary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we had sailed through the sea along the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we landed at Myra in Lycia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing for Italy, and he put us aboard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we had sailed slowly for a good many days, and with difficulty had arrived off Cnidus, since the wind did not permit us to go farther, we sailed under the shelter of Crete, off Salmone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with difficulty sailing past it we came to a place called Fair Havens, near which was the city of Lasea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When considerable time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, since even the fast was already over, Paul began to admonish them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Men, I perceive that the voyage will certainly be with damage and great loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the centurion was more persuaded by the pilot and the captain of the ship than by what was being said by Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the harbor was not suitable for wintering, the majority reached a decision to put out to sea from there, if somehow they could reach Phoenix, a harbor of Crete, facing southwest and northwest, and spend the winter there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a moderate south wind came up, supposing that they had attained their purpose, they weighed anchor and began sailing along Crete, close inshore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before very long there rushed down from the land a violent wind, called Euraquilo;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the ship was caught in it and could not face the wind, we gave way to it and let ourselves be driven along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Running under the shelter of a small island called Clauda, we were scarcely able to get the ship’s boat under control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had hoisted it up, they used supporting cables in undergirding the ship; and fearing that they might run aground on the shallows of Syrtis, they let down the sea anchor and in this way let themselves be driven along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day as we were being violently storm-tossed, they began to jettison the cargo;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the third day they threw the ship’s tackle overboard with their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since neither sun nor stars appeared for many days, and no small storm was assailing us, from then on all hope of our being saved was gradually abandoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had gone a long time without food, then Paul stood up in their midst and said, “Men, you ought to have followed my advice and not to have set sail from Crete and incurred this damage and loss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet now I urge you to keep up your courage, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator
