verses.text: For this very night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve stood before me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘Do not be afraid, Paul; you must stand before Caesar; and behold, God has granted you all those who are sailing with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, keep up your courage, men, for I believe God that it will turn out exactly as I have been told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we must run aground on a certain island.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fourteenth night came, as we were being driven about in the Adriatic Sea, about midnight the sailors began to surmise that they were approaching some land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took soundings and found it to be twenty fathoms; and a little farther on they took another sounding and found it to be fifteen fathoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fearing that we might run aground somewhere on the rocks, they cast four anchors from the stern and wished for daybreak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as the sailors were trying to escape from the ship and had let down the ship’s boat into the sea, on the pretense of intending to lay out anchors from the bow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, “Unless these men remain in the ship, you yourselves cannot be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the ship’s boat and let it fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until the day was about to dawn, Paul was encouraging them all to take some food, saying, “Today is the fourteenth day that you have been constantly watching and going without eating, having taken nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I encourage you to take some food, for this is for your preservation, for not a hair from the head of any of you will perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having said this, he took bread and gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it and began to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them were encouraged and they themselves also took food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of us in the ship were two hundred and seventy-six persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had eaten enough, they began to lighten the ship by throwing out the wheat into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When day came, they could not recognize the land; but they did observe a bay with a beach, and they resolved to drive the ship onto it if they could.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea while at the same time they were loosening the ropes of the rudders; and hoisting the foresail to the wind, they were heading for the beach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But striking a reef where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground; and the prow stuck fast and remained immovable, but the stern began to be broken up by the force of the waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers’ plan was to kill the prisoners, so that none of them would swim away and escape;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the centurion, wanting to bring Paul safely through, kept them from their intention, and commanded that those who could swim should jump overboard first and get to land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the rest should follow, some on planks, and others on various things from the ship. And so it happened that they all were brought safely to land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had been brought safely through, then we found out that the island was called Malta.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The natives showed us extraordinary kindness; for because of the rain that had set in and because of the cold, they kindled a fire and received us all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat and fastened itself on his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they began saying to one another, “Undoubtedly this man is a murderer, and though he has been saved from the sea, justice has not allowed him to live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However he shook the creature off into the fire and suffered no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were expecting that he was about to swell up or suddenly fall down dead. But after they had waited a long time and had seen nothing unusual happen to him, they changed their minds and began to say that he was a god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the leading man of the island, named Publius, who welcomed us and entertained us courteously three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that the father of Publius was lying in bed afflicted with recurrent fever and dysentery; and Paul went in to see him and after he had prayed, he laid his hands on him and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this had happened, the rest of the people on the island who had diseases were coming to him and getting cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also honored us with many marks of respect; and when we were setting sail, they supplied us with all we needed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of three months we set sail on an Alexandrian ship which had wintered at the island, and which had the Twin Brothers for its figurehead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After we put in at Syracuse, we stayed there for three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there we sailed around and arrived at Rhegium, and a day later a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There we found some brethren, and were invited to stay with them for seven days; and thus we came to Rome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the brethren, when they heard about us, came from there as far as the Market of Appius and Three Inns to meet us; and when Paul saw them, he thanked God and took courage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we entered Rome, Paul was allowed to stay by himself, with the soldier who was guarding him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days Paul called together those who were the leading men of the Jews, and when they came together, he began saying to them, “Brethren, though I had done nothing against our people or the customs of our fathers, yet I was delivered as a prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had examined me, they were willing to release me because there was no ground for putting me to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews objected, I was forced to appeal to Caesar, not that I had any accusation against my nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, therefore, I requested to see you and to speak with you, for I am wearing this chain for the sake of the hope of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “We have neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor have any of the brethren come here and reported or spoken anything bad about you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we desire to hear from you what your views are; for concerning this sect, it is known to us that it is spoken against everywhere.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had set a day for Paul, they came to him at his lodging in large numbers; and he was explaining to them by solemnly testifying about the kingdom of God and trying to persuade them concerning Jesus, from both the Law of Moses and from the Prophets, from morning until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some were being persuaded by the things spoken, but others would not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they did not agree with one another, they began leaving after Paul had spoken one parting word, “The Holy Spirit rightly spoke through Isaiah the prophet to your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the heart of this people has become dull,
And with their ears they scarcely hear,
And they have closed their eyes;
Otherwise they might see with their eyes,
And hear with their ears,
And understand with their heart and return,
And I would heal them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let it be known to you that this salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles; they will also listen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [When he had spoken these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves.]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stayed two full years in his own rented quarters and was welcoming all who came to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: preaching the kingdom of God and teaching concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all openness, unhindered.
verses.speaker: Narrator
